Due to the position of the e5 pawn the white has just limited range moves. He has to defend it with two figures - one is the queen but the other is either the knight or the rook. The black control of the center and the white pawns position does not allow the knight to get to any better square and the rook can not come to the third row in order to assist the white's attack and with the neutralization of the g4 possibility the white's King side attack came to a stop.

So now its time for the black to open the Queens side. Actually this is why I wanted the queen in the attacking position and not in the defending - I will have to admit that I was wrong.

As said before the opening should be in the Queen's side - not the middle. dxc4 opens the game for the white and places the black in not so good position. Furthermore the black d-pawn has open way to promotion.

The previous move have just made a possibility of coordinated attack of the Queen, the Rook and the Knight - but will there be time?
Admitting the mistake - better late than never. The queen will defend the King and control the center and the rook will go to the Queen's side attack.
Instead using three pieces to guard the crucial weak black squares (f7, f6 and c5) it is done with only the knight and the queen. So it is time to see what can be done on the Queen's side.

The only way for the white defend - it defends the weak b3 pawn with the rooks, it stops the d-pawn advancement with the rook and holds the knight and queen back with the knight and queen attack. 

Also now it has the possibility for the attack on the King's side - but...
